TestCase.Title: Test case TLS_B1_GP_04
TestCase.Purpose: This test ensures that the connection is not established if the client offers only elliptic curve cipher suites and unsupported curves according to the ICS.
TestCase.Precondition: DUT services are online without any known disturbances.
The DUT is accepting TLS connections.

Command.Text: The tester connects to the DUT.

TestStep.Description: The TLS ClientHello offers the highest TLS version supported according to the ICS.
The TLS ClientHello offers only an elliptic curve-based cipher suite that is supported according to the ICS.
The TLS ClientHello offers only elliptic curves which are not supported according to the ICS.
The presence of the signature_algorithms extension depends on the used TLS version. In case it is sent, all algorithms that are supported according to the ICS are listed.
The TLS ClientHello does not contain further extensions which are not required to conduct the TLS handshake.

ExpectedResult.Text: The DUT rejects the ClientHello and sends a "handshake failure" alert or another suitable error description.
